newsitem.title: ITALY: Italy's Ciampi welcomes city inflation data.
newsitem.headline: Italy's Ciampi welcomes city inflation data.

text.p: Treasury Minister Carlo Azeglio Ciampi on Tuesday welcomed data from 10 Italian cities which pointed to inflation falling to 3.0 percent year-on-year in October from 3.4 percent in September.
"This data...confirms government forecasts of a fall in annual inflation beneath three percent by the end of 1996," Ciampi said in a statement.
"It's possible to say today that the government objectives for 1996, both in terms of the average inflation figure of 3.9 percent for 1996 as a whole.
"This is the result of a culture of stability which is taking root in the country," the statement continued.
"It should futher be noted that the fall in market rates is carrying on with strength, both because of the fall in inflation and because of the reduced "Italian risk".
